description: A group of trench-coated investigators examine a figure on the ground near a carousel, implying a crime scene. The irony lies in the victim, identified as the attendant, having been trampled by the seemingly docile merry-go-round horses. This presents a darkly humorous and absurd scenario where a symbol of childhood fun becomes the instrument of a violent death. The presence of a photographer further emphasizes the treatment of this bizarre incident as a serious case.
caption: “It’s the attendant . . . he’s been trampled.”
